meanings.definition: The state or quality of being sessile.
meanings.sent1: The sessilities of the barnacles allow them to stay firmly on the rocks.
meanings.sent2: The sessilities of the plants in the garden make them easy to care for.
meanings.sent3: The sessilities of the glue were so strong that even Superman couldn't pull the papers apart!
meanings.sent4: Her love for him had the sessilities of a magnet, keeping her by his side always.
meanings.sent5: The sessilities of the tree roots were so deep that they cracked the pavement.

meanings.definition: The ability to remain attached or fixed in one place.
meanings.sent1: The sessilities of the suction cup kept it firmly stuck to the window.
meanings.sent2: The sessilities of the spider's web allowed it to catch insects for food.
meanings.sent3: The sessilities of the velcro made it impossible to separate the two pieces.
meanings.sent4: His loyalty had the sessilities of a strong bond, never wavering in tough times.
meanings.sent5: The sessilities of the anchor kept the boat secure in the stormy sea.
